page.title: 10Balvenie Castle.
page.content: Balvenie Castle is situated approximately 1km from the centre of Duftown.It commands a view over Glenfiddich and Balvenie distilleries. It was built in 1303. Its ownership has changed several times in the last 682 years.It is now in the guardianship of Scottish Developments Department.It was last lived in in 1718.One of its famous visitors was Mary Queen of Scots who stayed there for 2 nights during her campaign against the Gordons. The castle has a quadrangular court with towers on the North and West corners.It was formerly protected by a wide ditch which still exists on the South-west and North-west sides. The castle has 14 rooms.Guided tours can be given by the custodian.
